item.title: Mentioned by BlackburnNews.com
item.description:
Kick-Starting Windsor Hum Fight
Windsor-West MP Brian Masse is urging the federal Canadian and US governments not to wait to take action against the Windsor Hum. The NDP member of parliament says the study's lead researcher has already deemed the hum “real.” “The next phase will ...

item.title: Mentioned by Windsor Star
item.description:
petcoke removal hailed as victory
The petcoke is going to an unidentified location in Ohio for the time being. But MP Brian Masse warned "just because it's no longer here, we can't pretend it's a complete solution." Photograph by: Jason Kryk, The Windsor Star , The Windsor Star. Share.

item.title: Mentioned by BlackburnNews.com
item.description:
Toll Boost Angers Windsor MP
Toll Boost Angers Windsor MP. August 16th, 2013 7:01am. BlackburnNews.com file photo. As of this morning, it will cost you another quarter to cross the Ambassador Bridge, but Windsor West MP Brian Masse is trying have the decision reversed. In July of last ...

item.title: Mentioned by OurWindsor.ca
item.description:
Masse looking for government review of Bridge toll hike
MP Brian Masse is asking the Ministry of Transport to investigate a planned rise in tolls at the Ambassador Bridge. ... The NDP member of Parliament adds that Section 15.1 of the International Bridges and Tunnels Act enables the Minster to intercede in such cases, quoting, “ If the Minister is of the opinion that a change in the tolls, fees or other charges for the use of an international bridge or tunnel is resulting in adverse effects on the flow of traffic, the Minister may, with the approval of the Governor in Council, order ...

item.title: Mentioned by MetroNews Canada
item.description:
Windsor MP accuses Ambassador Bridge of 'gouging' travellers
Windsor West MP Brian Masse is urging the federal government to investigate a decision by the Ambassador Bridge Company to raise tolls. As of Aug. 15, tolls at the bridge will increase by five per cent from $4.75 to $5.00. In a letter to Transport Minister Lisa ...
